page.title: 06AGRICULTURE IN WESTON
page.content: At{Town Farm}they have sheep which are kept on the land at The Park. They have calves which are Freisian and Black Herefords. They have rape, oats and wheat, and 50 chickens. At{Old Farm}the farmer is in partnership with a farmer in Scotland. He keeps steers in a field behind the farm. He sometimes has sheep. {Fairclough Hall Farm}at Halls Green has 15 South Devon cows and 1 South Devon bull. They have 850 acres, 750 are for crops. They have 1 combine and 7 tractors. Recently they have planted three thousand mixed trees around the farm area. On the field next to the farm house is the site of an old village. The other farms are, {Oakley's Farm, {Bury Farm, Howells Farm, Warrens Green {Farm, Tilekiln Farm and Friends Green {Farm.
